hints.0: Do you go NORTH, or SOUTH? You can split the party if you like.

answers.0:
You head North. Take card 14

You should not take any cards with letters on the back for this route.
answers.1: You head South. Take card 35

hints.0: Formula One is also known as F1.
Such amazingly curious creatures!
hints.1: Send them into the smallest of exits!

3.name: Board

hints.0: It's Tricky to spot the number on this one

3.answer: You found a secret code! I will try not to use these secrets as ineffective self-therapy devices.

hints.0: How many fingers am I holding up on each hand?
Sorry you don't get a Korok seed.
Dogs don't have thumbs. You should have known that.
What are you, a cool guy, wearing a board and snowgloving down the mountain?

8.name: Bridge of letters

hints.0: Step on one tile per row and get across with pace
hints.1: The first letter is S, the last is D

hints2.0: Go back the way you came, but, backwards.

8.answer:
You jump across the bridge, avoiding the loose tiles, and find yourself in another room.

Discard %%discard%%

Take card 71
8.answer2:
You race back across the bridge, but the ceiling collapses and you find yourself falling into the depths below.

You conveniently land on %%vessel%% which takes you along the freezing river until you come to a giant door.

Take card 28

9.name: Door to exit

hints.0: Have the dogs brought the weird keys?
hints.1: Unlock the french door, with those weird locks.

9.answer: You find a wonderful vista through the unlocked door (not Windows). Take card 56

10.name: Fridge

hints.0: Throwback to old phones

10.answer: You open the fridge. Take card 90

14.name: Lost Josh

hints.0: Think back to Josh's Dobble cards. They are full of things he has, or is familiar with.
hints.1: Look at the backs of the cards you have

14.answer:
You help Josh recover his memory and take him to the meeting place. Take card 46.

Discard 14 and 78.

16.name: Slip of paper

hints.0: I love a good anagram, but this will have to do
hints.1: CARVE, like a turkey, or the snow

16.answer: You found a secret code card. This one entitles you to a free meal at Dan's home.

hints.0: You have to invert the letters
hints.1: INVERT is a snowbaording term, right?

Only something very hungry could eat something like this. Something with a big, strong appetite.

22.name: Old landline

hints.0: At least it isn't a rotary phone. Texting on those must have taken all month.

22.answer: You found a secret code! The print of this card got a bit messed up, as did a few others. Spot me Â£120 and I'll order a new set with the errors corrected.

hints.0: Oh my dog, how could you? It isn't even seasoned.
I'd be very piste off if my meal snowboarded out on me.

hints.0: This has no bearing on the rest of the game.

25.answer: You found a secret code! This is so stupid, but is probably my favourite thing in the game.

hints.0: Don't touch it with bare hands, bear hands, or bare hands fam.
Don't question the logic here. You have to put the food somewhere.

28.name: Stone door

hints.0: I hope you've been collecting paper.
hints.1: Solve the anagrams, stick them in, and see who comes out in a line

28.answer: Was this puzzle made for you? The door starts to slide down. Take card 29. Discard all the slip of paper cards.

hints.0: Mmmmm, discards.
I keep using the word 'back' for hints. I need to reverse this situation.
hints.1: Do you still have access to the bridge? You should.

hints.0: The disappointment when you hear a great song by a band to find the rest of their discography isn't great. That's the feeling I get when I find gloves on a plate when hoping for food.

35.name: Evil skiier

hints.0: You have to follow the path the evil skiier would take.
hints.1: You did something to this man, what was it? The cards should help you.
hints.2: CHASE is the thing you gave to this wretched soul.

35.answer:
Now that you've properly given chase, as in any 80's ski movie, you can go to the meeting point. Take card 46

Discard 35 and all letter cards.

36.name: Dining room

hints.0: If you collected all the food particles from the floors of every dining room in the world, how much food would you have?

36.answer: You found a secret code card. Thank you for putting in the effort - making this was not easy, and I really, really appreciate it.

hints.0: Easiest anagram of them all. Has something to do with skiing. And snowboarding. And winter.

42.name: Wine rack

hints.0: How can you make a 5-letter word out of given coordinates? Do you have enough wine?
hints.2: FACED will open the secret door for you

42.answer:
The wine rack swings open to reveal a hidden room.

Take card 36

hints.0: The disappointment when you hear a great song by a band to find the rest of their discography isn't great. That's the feeling I get when I find gloves on a plate when hoping for food.
We are all now part phone. I'm sure you can figure out how to take a photo. I was going to use facial recognition for this, but it is too expensive.
Due to a lack of foresight by the security team, each key clearly denotes which lock it is used for.
Originally there was a side-quest here, but it was taking too long to make.
Do we even have turkey at Christmas? I know we don't have christmas in Turkey.
If trains ever become driverless it will be a real problem for me

55.answer: You found a secret code! I have BIG HUGE MASSIVE love for my siblings and their partners.
